page.title: 14WILBERFOSS VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The villae shop is run along with the post office. It has recently been made much bigger and carries more stock. On average the shop has 1200 customers per day, with Thursday being the busiest because of it being pension-issue day. The item which is sold most is sweets and the most often-sold frozen food is peas. The present owners would like to expand the shop further by adding a butcher's department. The most common complaint from customers concerns prices, a fact that annoys the postmaster as there is little he can do about the problem. The shop owners have 4 people to help, one of whom works full time, the others part-time. The shop has recently been featured in a T.V. pro- gramme to be screened in 1986 on BBC "LOOK NORTH".
